titleStmt.title: Of the conversion of five thousand and nine hundred East-Indians, in the isle Formosa, neere China to the profession of the true God, in Jesus Christ : by meanes of M. Ro, Junius, a minister lately in Delph in Holland / related by ... M. C. Sibellius ... in a Latine letter ; translated ... by H. Jessei ... ; with a post-script of the Gospels good sucesse also amongst the VVest-Indians, in New England.
titleStmt.author: Sibelius, Caspar, 1590-1658.

titleStmt.title: Of the conversion of five thousand and nine hundred East-Indians, in the isle Formosa, neere China to the profession of the true God, in Jesus Christ : by meanes of M. Ro, Junius, a minister lately in Delph in Holland / related by ... M. C. Sibellius ... in a Latine letter ; translated ... by H. Jessei ... ; with a post-script of the Gospels good sucesse also amongst the VVest-Indians, in New England.
titleStmt.author: Sibelius, Caspar, 1590-1658.
Jessey, Henry, 1603-1663.
Shepard, Thomas, 1605-1649. Clear sunshine.
Wilson, John, 1588-1667. Day-breaking.
Winslow, Edward, 1595-1655. Glorious progress of the Gospel.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Iohn Hammond, and are to be sold ... by H. Allen,

notesStmt.note: "The post-script" (p. 13-37) consists of extracts from three of the Eliot tracts: The day-breaking ... John Wilson, supposed author; The clear sunshine ... by Thomas Shephard; The glorious progress of the Gospel ... by Edward Winslow.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
